result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Edward Poppen III

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard Edward Poppen in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Defendant Richard Edward Poppen in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also 16 CM 63.  State recites plea agreement - DE will plead to 16 CF 74 and 16 CM 63 DRI - 6 months county jail credit time served of 141 days and good time - costs.  DE entered plea of guilty.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court finds defendant guilty 16 CF 74 and 16 CM 63 is dismissed and read-in.

COURT:  6 months county jail with credit for 141 days time served,  good time and huber - Costs $518.00 given 30 days to pay or set up payment plan and 16 CM 63 is dismissed and read-in - $500.00 bond in 16 CM 63 is to be applied towards costs in 16 CF 74

ADDRESS INFO for Richard Edward Poppen III
Current: 111 Canal Drive, Rockford, MN 55373 United States  (Effective: 01-09-2017)
Prior: 10136 Olker Road, Hayward, WI 54843

Defendant Richard Edward Poppen in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Defendant Richard Edward Poppen in custody.  Aaron Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Larimore entered NG plea.  Court entered NG plea.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 7, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Richard Edward Poppen in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Defendant Richard Edward Poppen in custody.  Aaron Marcoux  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for December 6, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant Richard Edward Poppen in court, in custody by video.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 1, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Richard E. Poppen in court via video with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty McL addressed the court.  State makes stmt.  Atty McL moved to dismiss extradition filings.  

COURT:  15 CM 63 - Atty McL addressed court as to consolidating this case with Burnett County felony case
DEF arrested, hearing held-  No served paperwork received by COC yet.

Defendant Richard Edward Poppen in court, in custody appearing by video.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Court enters Not Guilty plea for DE.  Court sets $500 cash bond.  
  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Richard Edward Poppen III not in court at 0910 am.  Attorney James C. McLaughlin in court.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests warrant.  Counsel stands mute.  Court grants request - warrant authorized.
